document_type: ISO 27001 Security Requirements - Annex A Control
applies_to_note: All gambling operators subject to RTS Chapter 4 - Security Requirements

control.control_purpose: To ensure that the organization's approach to managing information security remains suitable, adequate, and effective
control.control_objective: Review the organization's approach to managing information security and its implementation independently at planned intervals to identify improvement opportunities and verify effectiveness

iso_27001_definition.official_text: The organisation's approach to managing information security and its implementation including people, processes and technologies should be reviewed independently at planned intervals, or when significant changes occur.
key_requirements: Information security management approach reviewed independently
Reviews conducted when significant changes occur
Corrective actions implemented based on findings

control_purpose_detail.purpose: Evaluative control ensuring information security management systems remain effective, suitable, and adequate
control_purpose_detail.independence_requirement: Reviews must be conducted by personnel independent of the area being reviewed to ensure impartial assessment

prerequisites.description: Before conducting independent reviews, foundational elements must be in place

required_prerequisites.description: Documented ISMS with policies, procedures, and controls
required_prerequisites.rationale: Cannot review what doesn't exist or isn't documented
required_prerequisites.reference: ISO 27001 A 5.1 - Policies for information security

required_prerequisites.description: All implemented controls documented and in operation
Process to implement corrective actions from review findings
required_prerequisites.rationale: Review findings must be acted upon to drive improvement

required_prerequisites.description: Mechanism for reporting review findings to management

independent_review_overview.definition: Systematic examination of information security management approach and implementation by personnel independent of operational responsibilities
independent_review_overview.independence_definition: Reviewer has no direct authority over or responsibility for the area being reviewed and brings objective perspective

implementation_requirements.requirement: Establish Independent Review Policy and Process
implementation_requirements.description: Create documented policy and process for conducting independent reviews

policy_elements: Objective: ensure suitability, adequacy, and effectiveness of ISMS
Scope: what will be reviewed (full ISMS or specific areas)
details.reference: ISO 27001 Clause 9.2 - Internal audit guidance applies

implementation_requirements.description: Develop review plan covering all critical information security areas

planning_elements: At least one comprehensive review annually covering full ISMS
Can include mix of internal and external reviews
scope_planning: All Annex A controls or subset based on risk

implementation_requirements.description: Select reviewers who are independent of areas being reviewed

independence_criteria: No direct authority over the area being reviewed
No responsibility for policies/procedures being reviewed
No conflict of interest in review findings
reviewer_sources: Combination of internal and external reviewers
Qualified professionals with no operational responsibility

implementation_requirements.description: Execute independent review examining information security management approach and implementation

review_areas: Information security policies - current, relevant, adequate
Information security governance - roles, responsibilities, accountability
Risk assessment and treatment - process effectiveness
Information security controls - implemented, effective, maintained

implementation_requirements.description: Evaluate information security approach against organizational needs and requirements

suitability.definition: Controls appropriate for organization's business context and risk profile
assessment: Approach matches organization size and complexity

adequacy.definition: Sufficient controls in place to manage identified information security risks

effectiveness.definition: Controls operating as designed to achieve objectives

implementation_requirements.description: Determine areas for enhancement based on review findings
Create comprehensive report documenting review results

details.documentation_level: Detailed enough to support corrective action process

implementation_requirements.description: Communicate review findings to appropriate management level

reporting_recipients: Board or governing body if necessary

implementation_requirements.description: Act on review findings to address identified gaps and improvements

corrective_action_process: Root cause analysis for each finding

implementation_requirements.requirement: Conduct Reviews When Significant Changes Occur
implementation_requirements.description: Perform additional independent reviews triggered by major organizational or security changes

trigger_events: Changes in regulatory environment or laws
response: Conduct focused review on affected areas

steps.detail: Document policy covering scope, frequency, reviewer requirements, and process
Develop detailed procedure for conducting reviews based on ISO 27001 Clause 9.2 and ISO/IEC 27007/27008 guidance
Create annual review plan covering full ISMS at minimum
Select qualified, independent personnel to conduct reviews (internal or external)
Provide training on review methodology, ISO 27001 requirements, and organizational ISMS
Execute comprehensive independent review of information security management system
Create detailed report of review findings, strengths, weaknesses, and recommendations
Present findings to management and document decisions
Address findings through corrective action process
Plan periodic reviews at least annually with trigger-based additional reviews

compliance_checklist.description: Steps to comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 5.35

checklist.item: Develop independent review policy and process
Train reviewers on process and requirements

common_mistakes.description: Top 3 mistakes organizations make with independent reviews

mistakes.description: Internal personnel conducting self-assessments rather than true independent reviews
root_cause: Cost savings by avoiding external auditors
Using security manager to review own work
mistakes.impact: Lack of objective perspective, biases in findings, missed issues, no real value from review
mistakes.prevention: Use truly independent reviewers - external auditors, qualified consultants, or personnel from unrelated departments
mistakes.requirement: Reviewer must have no authority over or responsibility for area being reviewed

mistakes.mistake: Reviews conducted but findings not acted upon
mistakes.description: Review completed but recommendations not implemented or tracked
root_cause: No formal process to act on findings
Review findings not elevated to decision-makers
mistakes.impact: Review provides no improvement, repeat findings in next review, wasted effort, no value demonstration
mistakes.best_practice: Include follow-up on previous corrective actions in next review

mistakes.mistake: Reviews not conducted at all or infrequently
mistakes.description: No regular independent reviews or reviews conducted inconsistently
mistakes.impact: Cannot demonstrate effectiveness, missed opportunities for improvement, control decay over time, audit findings
prevention: Schedule at least annual comprehensive review
Use both internal and external resources
mistakes.requirement: At minimum annual comprehensive review required

audit_requirements.description: What auditors will check during ISO 27001 A 5.35 audit

audit_areas.description: Verify documented policy and procedure for independent reviews
checks: Policy document exists and is current
Policy addresses all required elements from ISO 27001 Clause 9.2
audit_areas.best_practice: Policy clearly explains independence requirement and methodology

audit_areas.description: Verify reviews are planned and scheduled
checks: Plan identifies scope of each review
audit_areas.biggest_gotcha: No documented plan - reviews may be missed or inconsistent

audit_areas.description: Verify reviewers are truly independent of reviewed areas
checks: Reviewers have no authority over reviewed area
Reviewers have no responsibility for reviewed policies/controls
External auditors used or internal staff from different departments
audit_areas.warning: Reviewer bias invalidates entire review - must be truly independent

audit_areas.description: Verify reviews are actually conducted and findings documented
checks: Reports dated and reference review period

audit_areas.description: Verify review findings reported to appropriate management
checks: Management review meeting minutes include review discussion
Findings documented in management review records
audit_areas.best_practice: Formal presentation to executive or board level

audit_areas.description: Verify findings acted upon through corrective action process
checks: Corrective action log updated with review findings
Corrective actions planned for identified issues

audit_areas.description: Verify additional reviews conducted when significant changes occur
checks: Process defined for identifying trigger events
Assessment of need for additional reviews
Evidence of reviews conducted for major changes
Updates to policies/controls from reviews documented

ukgc_application.critical_systems_context: Independent reviews are essential for verifying that gambling operator security controls remain effective and aligned with regulatory requirements

review_requirements: Independent verification of RNG controls effectiveness
Assessment of game outcome integrity controls
Assessment of data retention and disposal
Verification of backup and recovery processes

ukgc_application.compliance_requirement: UKGC expects operators to conduct independent reviews at least annually demonstrating that information security controls remain suitable, adequate, and effective for protecting customers, ensuring game integrity, and maintaining regulatory compliance

compliance_notes.overall_purpose: Ensure information security management approach and implementation remain suitable, adequate, and effective through independent, objective assessment
compliance_notes.enforcement_priority: Critical - demonstrates continuous improvement and control effectiveness to regulators
key_principles: Reviews must be independent with no reviewer bias
At least annual comprehensive review required
Scope includes people, processes, and technologies
Assessment addresses suitability, adequacy, and effectiveness
Findings documented and reported to management
Corrective actions implemented based on findings
Additional reviews triggered by significant changes
Reviews feed into continual improvement process
Provides evidence of effective ISMS to auditors and regulators

to_pass_the_audit.description: To comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 5.35 Independent Review of Information Security, implement

requirements.detail: Policy defining scope, frequency, methodology, and independence requirements
Detailed procedure for conducting reviews aligned with ISO 27001 9.2 guidance
Schedule of planned reviews covering full ISMS
External auditors, qualified consultants, or truly independent internal personnel
Reviewers qualified in information security and ISO 27001
Execute comprehensive review examining all areas of ISMS
Formal report with detailed findings, assessment, and recommendations
Present findings to senior/top management with documented decisions
Act on findings through formal corrective action process
Perform additional reviews when significant changes occur

related_standards: ISO/IEC 27007 - Guidelines for information security management systems auditing
ISO/IEC TS 27008 - Guidelines for auditing information security controls
related_iso_controls: ISO 27001 Clause 9.2 - Internal audit (provides methodological guidance)
ISO 27001 Clause 10.1 - Continual improvement (outcome of reviews)
ISO 27001 Clause 10.2 - Corrective action (response to findings)

planning_best_practices: Schedule annual comprehensive review covering full ISMS
Include mix of internal and external reviews
Plan quarterly or semi-annual focused reviews
Document review schedule in annual planning
Allocate resources and budget for reviews
execution_best_practices: Use qualified external auditors for full independence
Provide reviewers with current ISMS documentation
Test control implementation through observation and sampling
Assess recent incidents and security events
Review changes implemented since last review
reporting_best_practices: Provide executive summary and detailed findings
Use clear language understandable to management
Prioritize recommendations by impact and urgency
Include assessment of suitability, adequacy, effectiveness
Identify quick wins and long-term improvements
follow_up_best_practices: Report on progress at management reviews
Include follow-up in next review scope

review_focus_areas.focus: Independent verification that RNG controls ensure game fairness and integrity
Assessment of controls protecting customer data, payments, and privacy
Verification of compliance with UKGC requirements for AML, KYC, responsible gambling
Assessment of business continuity and incident response capabilities

regulatory_expectations: Annual comprehensive independent review of all information security controls
External auditors used for full independence and credibility
Review findings documented and reported to board/senior management
Review demonstrates suitability of controls for gambling context
Evidence of ongoing improvement based on review findings
audit_readiness: Maintain records of all reviews conducted
Keep review reports and management presentations
Track improvements implemented based on reviews
